body.text: - Attorneys have a duty of confidentiality. - They can help you think through your legal options and figure out what you want to do next. - They can help you explore whether and how to achieve what you want: whether that is punishment for the offender, protection for yourself, immigration relief, educational benefits, financial compensation, etc. - Attorneys can prepare you for reporting to police or to Title IX, etc., and can help you feel less alone in the process. - They can provide you additional information on time limits for filing cases. - They can help you write a victim impact statement, and assist with filing for Victim Compensation. - If the attorney takes your case, they can represent you in legal proceedings.
